duties_responsibilities.duty: Plan and oversee the daily operations, administration, and team management of Residential Support Services (RSS) program.
Assist program management with administrative and clinical record keeping tasks, and ensure compliance with financial responsibilities.
Oversee the hiring, training, supervision, and performance evaluations of professional and non-professional staff.
Ensure that all services meet high standards of care and comply with legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements.
Provide direction to staff in the planning, development, and implementation of client treatment planning and services.
Maintain positive collaboration with community partners and agency/program fundraising efforts.
Assist in the procurement of additional housing, and oversee the maintenance of Buckelew housing to ensure safety and compliance with regulations.
Conduct housing inspections, maintain landlord/owner and neighborhood relationships, and address concerns as needed.

education_certification.credential: Associates degree in Social Services/Psychology (or related field) plus 6 years of experience; or a Bachelors degree plus four years of experience; or a Masters degree plus two years of experience in social services/psychology. Successful completion of 40-hour Adult Residential Facility Initial Certification within the first twelve months and maintenance of certification.
